Player History
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Kansas City on 7/1/1965...
Signed as a free agent by Houston on 2/10/1968 to a 2-year deal worth $4,500,000 per year...
Signed as a free agent by Chicago (A) on 2/14/1970 to a 2-year deal worth $2,687,000 per year...
Signed as a free agent by Atlanta on 2/12/1972 to a 4-year deal worth $975,200 per year...
Drafted in 1st round, 2nd overall pick, by Los Angeles in 1976...
Injured on 6/18/1979 with a Broken Ribs, out for 7 weeks...
Traded from Los Angeles to Atlanta on 5/1/1980 (Going to ATL: 3B W. Boggs, CF R. Henderson, 2B M. Barrett, P R. St. Claire. Going to LA: P B. Dillman, C B. Downing)...
Had first career hit on 4/1/1983, off Dennis Eckersley (STL)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/26/1983, off Gorman Heimueller (HOU)...
Won Rookie of the Year Award in 1983, hitting .279 with 4 HR, 54 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/5/1985, hitting .500 with 1 HR, 9 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/30/1985, hitting .542 with 0 HR, 8 RBI...
Was selected to the 1985 Allstar game...
Had 6 hits with 1 RBI against St. Louis on 4/4/1986...
Was selected to the 1986 Allstar game...
